info.title: Mediagraph API Documentation
info.description:
Authentication

Use your Mediagraph account via API with either a Personal Access Token or OAuth Access Token.

Personal Access Tokens

All endpoints using Personal Access Tokens (besides User specifics) require the OrganizationId header, which can be found in "Profile Settings" when logged into the Organization.

curl -u :YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN \
-H "OrganizationId: 100" \
"https://api.mediagraph.io/api/assets/search?q=sunset"

OAuth Access Tokens

OAuth Access Tokens use the Authorization header and are implicitly associated with the authorized Organization.

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_OAUTH_TOKEN" \
"https://api.mediagraph.io/api/assets/search?q=sunset"

OAuth Handshake URLs

StepMethodURL
AuthorizeGET or POSThttps://mediagraph.io/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=...&redirect_uri=...&state=...
Get TokenPOSThttps://mediagraph.io/oauth/token?grant_type=authorization_code&code=...
Revoke TokenPOSThttps://mediagraph.io/oauth/revoke?token=...

get.description: Returns a paginated list of access requests for the organization.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search by name, email, or user

parameters.name: submitted
parameters.description: Filter submitted requests (use 'all' for all states)

post.description: Create a new access request or grant. For grants, set `is_grant: true` and provide requester details.

asset_ids.description: Array of asset IDs to request access to

get.description: Returns a tree view of access requests grouped by state (pending, submitted, finalized).
Get details of a specific access request.

requested_other_permission.description: Requested permission level for other files

granted_other_permission.description: Granted permission level for other files

put.description: Update an access request. Different fields are editable depending on state.

get.description: Find an access request by ID or code. Public users can only find finalized requests by code.

post.description: Submit a pending access request for review.

get.description: Get versions for an Asset.

parameters.name: include_renditions
parameters.description: Include list of downloadable sizes and formats

get.description: Get version details for Asset using the Version number.
Searches all Assets you have access to in the Organization. POST is also supported for long lists e.g. Asset IDs.

parameters.name: as_filters
parameters.description: Aggregate counts will be formatted as Filters

parameters.name: include_renditions
parameters.description: Include list of downloadable sizes and formats

parameters.name: include_meta
parameters.description: Include all IPTC, EXIF, and XMP metadata (exiftool compatible)

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Array of Asset IDs to include.

parameters.name: guids
parameters.description: Array of Asset GUIDs to include.

parameters.name: upload_guid
parameters.description: The GUID for the Upload session

parameters.name: omit_child_storage_folders
parameters.description: Omit assets belonging to sub-level Storage Folders (top-level only)

parameters.name: omit_child_collections
parameters.description: Omit assets belonging to sub-level Collections (top-level only)

parameters.name: omit_child_lightboxes
parameters.description: Omit assets belonging to sub-level Lightboxes (top-level only)

parameters.name: lightbox_folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of a Folder ("Bin") within a Lightbox.

parameters.name: omit_child_lightbox_folders
parameters.description: Omit assets belonging to sub-level Lightboxe Folders (top-level only)

parameters.name: snapshot_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp (in milliseconds) to filter assets created before this time, used for consistent pagination

parameters.name: custom_meta
parameters.description: Search Custom Meta Values by name, using an array for controlled vocabulary values, e.g. `"custom_meta": {"Custom Field 1 Name": "value 1", "Controlled Vocab Field 2 Name": ["controlled vocab value 1", "controlled vocab value 2"}`

parameters.name: contribution_id
parameters.description: View all Assets from a Contribution Request

parameters.name: my_contribution_id
parameters.description: View my Assets from a Contribution Request

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order, add '-asc' or '-desc' for direction

parameters.name: aasm_state
parameters.description: Search by Asset processing state (must have Manage Asset permissions). Defaults to `processed` unless overridden or `upload_id` or `upload_guid` specified. Supports comma delimited list for multiple.

parameters.name: all_ids
parameters.description: Return all Asset IDs in search results, un-paginated.

get.description: Downloads the Asset. Partial downloading is supported using the header: `Range: bytes=<start>-<end>`

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum size requested for assets in the download (default original). To use a specific Crop Preset, use the format `size=crop-preset-{id}`.

parameters.name: via
parameters.description: Description of the app or integration making the API call

parameters.name: skip_meta
parameters.description: Do not write metadata on the fly to the file (original file size and MD5 will match)

post.description:
Prepare a new asset version upload using this endpoint, 
then PUT the data to the returned `signed_upload_url`, 
and finally call `/api/assets/:id/set_uploaded` when the upload is complete.

created_via.description: Name of external service creating this Asset, e.g. 'api' or 'lightroom'

created_via_id.description: ID for the file on the external service.

signed_upload_url.description: Use this URL to PUT the file data on S3.

get.summary: Asset IDs Updated Since Last Sync
get.description:
Returns all of your created Asset IDs with `last_external_sync_at` less than `updated_at`. 
The timestamp is set in Search, Details, and Update when parameter `sync=true`.

parameters.name: created_via
parameters.description: Service that created the Assets; uses the `created_via` field e.g. 'lightroom'

parameters.name: last_sync_at
parameters.description: Timestamp to include un-synced Assets created after this time

parameters.name: any_user
parameters.description: Include Assets from any user in the Organization (requires Content Manager or Admin permission)

post.description:
Create a new bulk job to perform batch operations on assets. Specify asset_ids and one or more operations to perform.

Common operations include:
- **Tag Management**: Add, remove, or replace tags using `tag_names` and `tag_mode`
- **Metadata Updates**: Update description, rights package, custom meta fields
- **Asset Organization**: Move to folders/collections using `add_asset_group_id`
- **AI Processing**: Run CAI fields using `run_custom_meta_field_ids`

asset_ids.description: Array of Asset IDs to process

add_asset_group_id.description: ID of Collection/Lightbox/StorageFolder to add assets to

remove_asset_group_id.description: ID of Collection/Lightbox to remove assets from

remove_asset_group_type.description: Type of asset group to remove from

custom_meta.description: Custom meta field values to set (keyed by field name)

run_custom_meta_field_ids.description: Array of Custom Meta Field IDs to run AI on

cmf_overwrite_mode.description: Whether to overwrite existing values when running AI

restore_all.description: Restore all specified assets from trash

alt_text_generation_prompt.description: Custom prompt for alt text generation

200.description: Create Bulk Job to Add Tags

get.description: Returns bulk jobs that are currently in the processing state for the current user.
Get details of a specific bulk job by its GUID.

warnings.description: Array of warning messages from processing

post.description: Cancel a pending or processing bulk job. The job must belong to the current user.

Preview which assets have existing values for specified Composable AI (CAI) custom meta fields.
This helps users understand the impact of running AI on assets with or without existing data.

post.description:
Create a new custom meta field for the organization.

**Value Types:**
- `text` - Text input (default)
- `number` - Numeric input
- `date` - Date picker

**For Controlled Vocabularies:**
Set `free: false` and provide `custom_meta_values_attributes` with the allowed values.

**For AI (CAI) Fields:**
Set `enable_ai: true` along with `model`, `prompt`, and `source_data` configuration.

via.description: Description of the app or integration making the API call

skip_meta.description: Do not write metadata on the fly to the file (original file size and MD5 will match)

end_time.description: Start time for video slice downloads in seconds (e.g. 10.2)

asset_ids.description: The IDs of the Assets to download

token.description: The unique token that can be used to download the data using the `show` endpoint

filename.description: The suggested filename to use to save the file locally

application/json.rights_class_description: Company has no rights. E.g. A competitors product brochure or advertisements

application/json.name: Library Rights Only
application/json.description: Org has the right to store the object in our library, but no further rights are secured. E.g. images submitted to account for informational purposes.
application/json.rights_class_description: Org has the right to store the object in our library, but no further rights are secured. E.g. images submitted to account for informational purposes.

application/json.name: Limited Use

application/json.rights_class_description: Org has some rights to the object as spelled out in a rights agreement

application/json.name: Unlimited Use
application/json.description: org has unlimited use of the object, but does not have copyright ownership. E.g. commissioned work acquired under a contract that specifies unlimited use, or submissions that are specified as unlimited use
application/json.rights_class_description: org has unlimited use of the object, but does not have copyright ownership. E.g. commissioned work acquired under a contract that specifies unlimited use, or submissions that are specified as unlimited use

application/json.name: Owned by Organization

post.description:
Prepare the Asset to be uploaded to S3. Use the `signed_upload_url` response attribute to then upload via PUT. E.g:
`curl -v --upload-file path/to/file.jpg "{signed_upload_url}"`. Then use the `/set_uploaded` endpoint once the data upload to S3 is complete. 
Note that the `signed_upload_url` is only valid for 1 hour.

available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: e.g. employee-created image done as part of job description, or commissioned work done under work for hire contract

available_rights_packages.name: Unlimited Use
available_rights_packages.description: org has unlimited use of the object, but does not have copyright ownership. E.g. commissioned work acquired under a contract that specifies unlimited use, or submissions that are specified as unlimited use
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: org has unlimited use of the object, but does not have copyright ownership. E.g. commissioned work acquired under a contract that specifies unlimited use, or submissions that are specified as unlimited use

available_rights_packages.name: Limited Use
available_rights_packages.description: Org has some rights to the object as spelled out in a rights agreement
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: Org has some rights to the object as spelled out in a rights agreement

available_rights_packages.name: Library Rights Only
available_rights_packages.description: Org has the right to store the object in our library, but no further rights are secured. E.g. images submitted to account for informational purposes.
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: Org has the right to store the object in our library, but no further rights are secured. E.g. images submitted to account for informational purposes.

available_rights_packages.name: No Rights
available_rights_packages.description: Company has no rights. E.g. A competitors product brochure or advertisements
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: Company has no rights. E.g. A competitors product brochure or advertisements

available_rights_packages.name: Rights Unknown (Havent Searched)
available_rights_packages.description: This is a default unknown setting that just indicates that no rights tags have been applied.
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: This is a default unknown setting that just indicates that no rights tags have been applied.

available_rights_packages.name: Rights Unknown (Have Searched)
available_rights_packages.description: This helps to track whether its likely that rights can even be discovered definitively.
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: This helps to track whether its likely that rights can even be discovered definitively.

available_rights_packages.name: Unassigned
available_rights_packages.description: This is a Rights Status placeholder for a Rights Package that does not yet have an assigned status.
available_rights_packages.rights_class_description: This is a Rights Status placeholder for a Rights Package that does not yet have an assigned status.

post.description:
Create a new webhook to receive event notifications.

**Available Events:**
- `asset.created` - Asset uploaded
- `asset.updated` - Asset metadata changed
- `asset.deleted` - Asset moved to trash
- `asset.restored` - Asset restored from trash
- `collection.updated` - Collection modified

url.description: Destination URL to POST events to

events.description: Comma-separated list of events to listen for

asset_group_id.description: Scope to specific Collection or StorageFolder

include_download_url.description: Include asset download URL in payload

group_assets.description: Group multiple asset events into single request

get.description: Get details of a specific webhook.

asset_group_id.description: Asset group ID if scoped to a specific collection/folder

include_download_url.description: Whether to include download URL in payload

group_assets.description: Whether to group assets in batch notifications

Authorization.description:
Your Personal Access Token

Generate here: https://mediagraph.io/account/personal-access-tokens

Use the basic auth password attribute, username can be omitted.


OAuth Access Tokens use the `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header.
Authorization.name: Personal Access Token

tags.name: Access Requests
tags.description: Access Requests allow users to request access to assets. Grants are a special type of access request where an admin grants access to external users. The workflow supports pending, submitted, and finalized states.

tags.name: Asset Data Versions
tags.description: Asset Data Versions resources.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: Asset resources.

tags.name: Auto Tags
tags.description: Auto Tags are automatically generated tags from AI/ML analysis (like AWS Rekognition). They can be converted to regular tags or dismissed.

tags.name: Bulk Jobs
tags.description: Bulk Jobs are used for batch operations on assets such as adding tags, updating metadata, moving assets between folders, and running AI-powered metadata generation.

tags.name: Collection Shares
tags.description: Collection Shares enable federated sharing of Collections between organizations within a Federation. This allows one organization to share their collections with other organizations in the same federation.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description: Collection resources.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description:
Comments allow users to have discussions on Lightboxes and Collections.
Comments support @mentions and are rendered as markdown.

Note: The index and create endpoints require `type` and `id` query parameters
to identify the commentable object (Lightbox or Collection).

tags.name: Contributions
tags.description: Contributions (Upload Links) allow organizations to receive asset uploads from external contributors. Each contribution can have specific settings for where assets are stored, what metadata is collected, and how uploads are processed.

tags.name: Creator Tags
tags.description: Creator Tags represent photographers, artists, or other content creators. They can be associated with assets to track authorship.

tags.name: Crop Presets
tags.description: Crop Presets define standard crop sizes for asset downloads. Organizations can create named presets with specific dimensions.

tags.name: Custom Meta Fields
tags.description: Custom Meta Fields allow organizations to define custom metadata schemas for their assets. Fields can be controlled vocabularies (dropdown/multi-select), free text, or AI-powered (CAI - Composable AI) for automated metadata generation.

tags.name: Downloads
tags.description: Downloading Assets.

tags.name: Filter Groups
tags.description: Filter Groups allow organizations to save and organize search filter configurations. Users can create named filter groups to quickly apply common search criteria.

tags.name: Ingestions
tags.description: Ingestions track the status of asset uploads from external sources like cloud storage integrations (Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.).

tags.name: Invites
tags.description: Invites allow organization administrators to invite new users to join their organization. Invites can specify role levels and user group memberships.

tags.name: Lightboxes
tags.description: Lightbox resources.

tags.name: Memberships
tags.description: Memberships resources. Admin role required.

tags.name: Meta Imports
tags.description: Meta Imports allow bulk updating of asset metadata from CSV/Excel spreadsheets. Users can upload a spreadsheet, map columns to asset fields, and apply the metadata to matching assets.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Notifications inform users about activity in their organization, such as comments, uploads, and workflow updates.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: Organization resources.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description: Permissions define access levels for user groups to assets. They control what actions users can perform (view, download) and for which asset types (image, video, audio, other).

tags.name: Personal Access Tokens
tags.description: Personal Access Tokens allow users to authenticate API requests without using their session credentials. Tokens can be created for integrations like Lightroom.

tags.name: Rights Packages
tags.description: Rights Packages define usage rights and licensing terms that can be assigned to assets. Each package has a rights class (e.g., Royalty Free, Rights Managed) and can include contracts.

tags.name: Search Queries
tags.description:
Search Queries allow users to save and reuse complex search filters.
Saved searches can be quickly accessed and shared.
The `sql` field uses Elasticsearch SQL syntax for the WHERE clause.

tags.name: Share Links
tags.description: Share Links allow you to share Collections, Lightboxes, or Storage Folders externally with configurable permissions for images/videos and other file types.

tags.name: Shares
tags.description: Shares allow you to create public links to share assets or collections externally. Shares can be configured with different sizes, watermarks, and download permissions.

tags.name: StorageFolders
tags.description: Storage Folders resources.

tags.name: Taggings
tags.description: Taggings represent the association between tags and assets. They can also be associated with detected faces for person tagging.

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Tag resources.

tags.name: Taxonomies
tags.description: Taxonomy resources.

tags.name: TaxonomyTags
tags.description: Taxonomy Tag resources.

tags.name: Uploads
tags.description: Uploading Assets.

tags.name: User Groups
tags.description: User Groups allow organizations to organize members into groups with shared permissions. Groups can have associated collections, storage folders, and contribution settings.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks allow you to receive real-time HTTP notifications when events occur in Mediagraph, such as asset uploads, metadata changes, or collection updates.

tags.name: Workflow Steps
tags.description: Workflow Steps are individual stages within a workflow. Each step can have assigned reviewers and approval requirements.

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description: Workflows define multi-step approval processes for assets. Each workflow contains steps that can require approvals before assets proceed.
